title: Penalties, warnings fail to curb wrong-side driving on city roads

content: Haryana Tourism Minister Arvind Sharma, who visited the accident spot, said that directions were issued for a thorough investigation of the entire incident and assured strict action against the culprits

content: ECI officials have said orphanage‚Äôs name should be entered in the column for parents, but lack of specific guidelines leads to chaos on the ground; with no lineage proof, State must provide needed documentation

content: The Karbi Anglong district authorities instructed them to exit via Dhubri, Sribhumi or South Salmara-Mankachar districts, bordering Bangladesh

content: IIT JEE and NEET coaching major expands footprint in Rayalaseema with schools and colleges offering CBSE and integrated programmes

content: BJP president highlights higher tax share, doubled grants and infrastructure push while addressing Budget discussion in Thrissur. Benefits for agricultural sectors such as cashew and cocoa would reach Kerala, he says.

content: The plan to relocate about 9,000 families achieved ‚Äúonly 27%¬†progress‚Äù in 17 years, the J&K government tells Assembly; only 1,808 families were resettled, say officials

content: The programme was held from 12 noon to 1 p.m., during which HYDRAA Commissioner A.V. Ranganath interacted directly with complainants

title: Girls leading in UG medical admissions in Andhra Pradesh, says report
content: Girls have secured 60.72% of the total MBBS seats, while the same for dental and AYUSH programmes fall between 76.17% and 85%

content: Police record statements of both survivor and spa owner and an inquiry is also under way to ascertain whether the spa was involved in any illegal activities

content: All arjitha and paroksha sevas cancelled during the 11-day festivities; separate queue lines, water facilities and free laddu prasadams arranged for devotees

title: Scheyer: Staff got 'punched' in UNC's court storm
content: Duke coach Jon Scheyer said he had staff members "that got punched in the face" as North Carolina fans stormed the court to celebrate a late winning shot in the famed rivalry Saturday night.

title: Sengun sorry for sexist remark at female official
content: Rockets center Alperen Sengun expressed remorse for calling a female referee a 'b----' earlier this week and said he apologized to her after the game.

title: Embattled Fears starts, leads Spartans to OT win
content: Jeremy Fears capped a tumultous week by scoring a game-high 26 points to lead Michigan State to an 85-82 overtime win over Illinois.

title: Lakers look to model team after champion Dodgers
content: The Lakers are working with the Dodgers in the hopes of modeling the team's practices and structure after the back-to-back World Series champions.

title: Jokic passes Robertson for 2nd in triple-doubles
content: Nikola Jokic passed Oscar Robertson for the second-most triple-doubles in NBA history with 182 in Saturday's win over the Bulls.

title: Falcons rookie Pearce arrested on battery charges
content: Falcons linebacker James Pearce Jr., who finished third in Defensive Rookie of the Year voting, was arrested after police said he fled a domestic dispute and crashed his vehicle during a police chase.

title: Sources: WNBA updates housing in latest proposal
content: The WNBA's latest CBA proposal includes for the first time some concessions on housing but does not have significant updates to revenue sharing, sources told ESPN on Saturday.

title: Former MLB speedster Terrance Gore dies at 34
content: Terrance Gore, a dynamic baserunner whose speed impacted postseason games for the better part of a decade, has died at age 34.

content: One of the event's participants, Button, was rescued by Nickel City Canine Rescue, a Buffalo area nonprofit dog rescue that Shakir and his Shakir Family Foundation have partnered with many times.

content: Inter Milan and multiple MLS clubs are hoping to sign Weston McKennie this summer. Transfer Talk has the latest.

content: Jordan Reid ranked the top 50 players in the 2026 NFL draft class, including scouting reports and standouts at every position.

content: Andre Snellings and Eric Moody provide fantasy reactions as trades go down leading up to Thursday's NBA trade deadline.

title: 'Drew Nazi symbol with their blood': Chilling details emerge as four Indian students stabbed in Russia
content: A 15-year-old, allegedly linked to a banned neo-Nazi group, stabbed at least six people, including four Indian students, at a Russian university dormitory. The attacker reportedly shouted Holocaust-related slogans and drew a Nazi symbol with victims' blood. He also injured two police officers and himself before being apprehended.

title: Days after 32-hour ordeal, Mumbai-Pune Expressway clogged yet again
content: Mumbai-Pune expressway faced another weekend traffic nightmare with heavy vehicles causing significant delays. This follows a recent 32-hour snarl from a tanker accident. Officials cite election-related travel and the resumption of stalled truck movement for the persistent gridlock, turning peak hours into a frustrating crawl for thousands.

title: Speeding Audi runs over family distributing wedding cards in MP; 3 dead
content: A speeding Audi collided with a motorcycle in Rewa, Madhya Pradesh, killing three people, including a father and his son. The victims were distributing wedding invitations when the tragic accident occurred near Kosta village. The car's driver has been taken into custody as investigations continue.

title: 'Wife hunt': Norway's crown princess faces backlash over Epstein link; issues apology
content: Norway's Crown Princess Mette-Marit faces backlash over past contact with Jeffrey Epstein, issuing a "profound apology" after emails revealed intimate exchanges and a stay at his home.  Meanwhile, her son, Marius Borg H√∏iby, is on trial denying rape charges, with the Crown Prince emphasizing his private citizen status.

title: Suryakumar Yadav walks away from toss to hug Rohit Sharma - Watch
content: Suryakumar Yadav's heartwarming gesture towards Rohit Sharma preceded his match-winning 84, rescuing India from a collapse against the USA.  A disciplined bowling performance, led by Siraj, secured a 29-run victory in their T20 World Cup opener.

title: Google employees send letter to top execs demanding to cut ties with DHS
content: Nearly 1,000 Google employees are demanding the company sever ties with the Department of Homeland Security, citing contracts with ICE and CBP. They allege Google's technology fuels "state violence and repression." The workers seek transparency on contracts, an immediate Q&A session, and assurances of safety for all employees, particularly those in vulnerable roles.

title: Trade deal: US whiskey, wine unlikely to give headache to Indian companies
content: Duty concessions on American whiskey and wine are unlikely to significantly impact Indian companies due to minimum import prices and low existing volumes. American whiskey holds less than 0.1% of the Indian market, with distinct flavors appealing to a niche segment. Similarly, imported wines face distribution challenges, with Australian wines leading the small segment.

title: Elon Musk denies Starlink phone: CEO says no device in works
content: Elon Musk has officially denied reports of SpaceX developing a Starlink phone, stating "We are not developing a phone." This clarification comes amidst speculation about the satellite internet business's expansion ahead of a potential IPO. Musk has previously expressed strong reluctance towards phone manufacturing.

title: GCC Unified Visa 2026: Guide for single entry to 6 Gulf countries
content: The GCC is launching a unified tourist visa, allowing entry to all six member states with a single online application. Travellers can expect a streamlined digital process, requiring essential documents like a valid passport, itinerary and proof of funds. This initiative aims to simplify multi-country travel across Saudi Arabia, UAE, Qatar, Kuwait, Bahrain and Oman.

title: B'desh Hindu leader Ramesh Chandra Sen dies in jail, raising custodial treatment concerns
content: Ramesh Chandra Sen, a senior Hindu leader of Bangladesh Awami League, died in Dinajpur District Jail. This incident raised concerns about the treatment of political prisoners.  His passing comes at a sensitive political juncture for Bangladesh as it's about face its first poll since sheikh Hasina' ouster on Feb 12.

title: 'Abhi bohot dur tak hai jaana': Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's humble words after conquering the world
content: Fourteen-year-old Vaibhav Sooryavanshi's extraordinary 175 off 80 balls powered India to a record-extending sixth ICC Under-19 World Cup title, crushing England by 100 runs. His stellar performance, featuring 15 fours and 15 sixes, overshadowed England's Caleb Falconer's century. Sooryavanshi expressed gratitude and acknowledged the journey ahead.

title: 'Don't be alarmed': Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang to Google, Microsoft, Meta investors
content: Nvidia's CEO reassures investors about the substantial capital expenditures by tech giants like Google, Microsoft, Meta, and Amazon on AI infrastructure. He asserts that these investments, totaling billions, are appropriate and sustainable, driven by immense AI demand. This spending surge is significantly boosting Nvidia's stock, despite broader market concerns.

title: 'Psychological issues, was in debt‚Äô: Ex-owner of Multani Bakery jumps from 17th floor, dies
content: Former owner of Solapur's renowned Multani Bakery, Sunil Motilal Sadarangani, died by suicide by jumping from a 17th-floor apartment building. Police suspect psychological issues and debt contributed to his actions. Sadarangani had sold his bakery and relocated to Pune, with his family confirming his struggles.

title: Delhi biker death case: Contractor who‚Äôd dug pit came, saw and left as victim lay there for hours
content: A 25-year-old biker died after falling into a 14-foot pit in Janakpuri. The sub-contractor who dug the pit was arrested after he allegedly saw the victim and left without calling for help. The pit was dug just hours before the accident, with no warning signs or barricades.

title: Ahead of Macron‚Äôs visit, DAC likely to meet next week to approve deal for 114 Rafales
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council is set to consider a major proposal to purchase 114 Rafale fighter jets from France for approximately Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement, with a substantial portion to be manufactured in India, aims to bolster the Indian Air Force's fighter squadron strength amidst rising regional security concerns.

title: Amitabh Bachchan reacts to ‚Äòthird-rate‚Äô actor remark by journalist
content: Amitabh Bachchan celebrated India's U19 Cricket World Cup victory, reflecting on the nation's elevated global standing. He recalled a past experience where he was labeled a "third-rate actor from a third-world country," a comment that deeply hurt him. Bachchan asserted that India is no longer a third-world nation but a first-world one, evidenced by its numerous world championships.

title: PM Modi, Malaysia PM Anwar Ibrahim hold talks on defence, economy and ASEAN - top developments
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi received a ceremonial welcome in Malaysia, marking a key moment in his two-day official visit. Bilateral talks with Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim are focusing on defence, economic cooperation, and innovation, aiming to further strengthen their Comprehensive Strategic Partnership.

title: 'Should've sent Pak home': Netherlands left distraught after defeat in tense match
content: The Netherlands felt they lost their T20 World Cup opener against Pakistan due to poor execution in the final overs, not Pakistan outplaying them. A dropped catch and missed opportunities allowed Faheem Ashraf to change the game, securing a Pakistan victory. Despite the disappointment, the team remains proud of their fight and looks to their next match.

title: The $500 billion question: What will India import from US?
content: India aims to import $500 billion in US goods over five years, but success hinges on American suppliers meeting demand.  While oil and coal imports are set to rise, high-tech items like chips and aircraft face supply chain challenges.  Indian buyers and US sellers must collaborate to achieve this ambitious trade target.

title: 'I don't do 50/50': Kayla Nicole opens up on finances with Travis Kelce
content: While Travis Kelce moved on in his life with Taylor Swift, his ex girlfriend, popular social media influencer, Kayla Nicole's controversial statements about how she managed finances while dating the star player have sparked chaos. Over the last few years, Kayla Nicole has also been brutally trolled for allegedly making subtle digs at Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's high profile relationship.

title: Real Madrid, Ramadan and rest: How Siraj's February got a T20 World Cup addition
content: Mohammed Siraj‚Äôs quiet February plans, featuring family time, Ramadan and a Real Madrid match, were upended by a sudden SOS from India‚Äôs T20 leadership. Drafted into the World Cup squad after an injury crisis and Siraj delivered at the Wankhede.

title: IS owns up 'suicide attack' on Pakistan Shia mosque; toll now 36
content: The Islamic State has claimed responsibility for a deadly blast at a Shia mosque in Islamabad, which resulted in over three dozen casualties. The terror outfit's mouthpiece stated the attack was a Fidayeen operation by a soldier of the Islamic State in Pakistan Province. This claim comes amidst growing sectarian tensions and an IS call for Lashkar-e-Taiba members to defect.

title: Mavericks vs Spurs injury report: Playing status, head-to-head, stats & more
content: The Dallas Mavericks will play the San Antonio Spurs on February 7, 2026. San Antonio is in strong form while Dallas faces significant injury issues. The Spurs have won both previous meetings this season. Player availability will be crucial in this matchup. This game offers Dallas a chance to gauge progress against a top Western Conference team.

title: Injury updates: Washington to join squad soon; Bumrah, Abhishek under the weather
content: Washington Sundar last played a competitive fixture nearly a month ago during the ODI series vs New Zealand. The all-rounder injured himself while bowling in the 1st ODI in Vadodara and went on to miss the remainder of the series, and the five T20Is which followed

title: MLB trade rumours: Reds tipped to land $10.2m Yankees slugger to boost title odds
content: Cincinnati Reds are eyeing Jazz Chisholm Jr. to bolster their lineup, potentially trading pitcher Brady Singer and infielder Matt McLain. Chisholm offers proven power and speed, addressing the Reds' offensive struggles. The Yankees, seeking pitching depth and infield versatility, might consider the deal to manage future payroll. This move could boost Cincinnati's playoff hopes.

title: 'Tracked her movements': How a UP man helped Bengaluru techie murder his wife
content: Bengaluru police arrested a 32-year-old man from Varanasi for allegedly assisting software engineer Balamurugan in his wife's murder by tracking her live location. Abhimanyu Singh, an assistant to a gold merchant, was taken into custody for his role in the conspiracy. He allegedly shared the victim's movements with Balamurugan, enabling the murder.

title: Propose day wishes: 75+ messages, greetings, wishes and quotes
content: Propose Day on February 8th, 2026, is the perfect opportunity to express your love. The article offers over 75 messages, from deeply romantic to funny and "filmy," catering to all relationship stages. Find the ideal words to "shoot your shot" and aim for that "Yes."

title: Govt spent barely 40% of Budget on biggest schemes in 9 months
content: Government spending on major schemes lags significantly, with only 41.2% of the budgeted amount disbursed in the first nine months. Revised estimates for 47 out of 53 large projects are lower than initially planned. Several key initiatives, including the Jal Jeevan Mission, show drastically reduced spending, raising concerns about project execution and fund utilization.

title: Suryakumar scripts history, triggers Netravalkar's worst-ever T20I WC spell
content: India's T20 World Cup opener saw a dramatic turnaround, with Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 84 off 49 balls rescuing the team from a precarious 77 for 6. His captain's knock, the second-highest debut score in T20 World Cup history, guided India to a competitive total despite a costly spell from Saurabh Netravalkar.

title: 'Border 2' crosses Rs 300 crore mark in India
content: Sunny Deol's 'Border 2' has crossed the Rs 300 crore mark domestically, reaching approximately Rs 301.5 crore. The war film's worldwide collection stands at around Rs 412 crore, with overseas earnings of Rs 52 crore.

title: Trust has become India's strongest currency: PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi highlighted recent trade agreements with the US and other nations as proof of growing global trust in India. He emphasized the country's shift from a mere market to an investment and trade hub, fostering 'Make in India' and creating jobs. These deals, he stated, reflect a dynamic partnership and commitment to innovation and shared prosperity.

title: 'Politically motivated': Sonia Gandhi slams plea over 1980 voter list inclusion
content: Sonia Gandhi Saturday termed a criminal revision petition against a magisterial order as "politically motivated and frivolous." The petition alleges her name was included in electoral rolls in 1980 using forged documents, despite her acquiring Indian citizenship later. Gandhi argued citizenship and electoral roll issues fall outside criminal court jurisdiction.

title: Dramatic turnaround: From brink of collapse, PM Modi & Trump deliver a deal
content: India and the US have reached a breakthrough interim trade agreement, a significant shift from recent tensions. This deal, a precursor to a larger pact, offers advantages to India's MSME and labor-intensive sectors. Negotiators successfully resisted pressure on sensitive agricultural imports, a move likely to please the US president's base ahead of mid-term polls.

title: Three-storeyed building collapses in Rajasthan's Kota; 2 killed, several feared trapped
content: A three-storey building housing a restaurant collapsed in Kota, Rajasthan, killing at least two people and leaving several others feared trapped. Rescue operations are underway, with five individuals already rescued and hospitalized. The incident occurred in the Talwandi area, and authorities are working to ascertain the full extent of casualties.

title: India, US discuss ways to boost collaboration in critical, emerging defence tech
content: India and the US convened in New Delhi to bolster cooperation in cutting-edge defence technologies. The 24th Indo-US Joint Technical Group Plenary Meeting focused on enhancing joint research and development, involving universities, labs, and industries. Discussions aimed to address evolving defence needs and explore new collaborative avenues, culminating in a project agreement.

title: India-US trade deal: Farmers question import of animal feed, soybean oil
content: India's decision to import animal feed like DDGs and soybean oil from the US has sparked farmer concerns, who fear the products originate from genetically modified crops. While the government assures that all domestic crops remain safe and GM traces are eliminated post-processing, farm organizations are seeking greater clarity on the agreement's implications for local agriculture and farmer incomes.

title: Tamil literature is eternal and its culture global, PM Modi says in Malaysia
content: Prime Minister Modi lauded Tamil culture at a Kuala Lumpur event, highlighting its global reach and the significant presence of Tamilians in India's leadership. He announced UPI's upcoming availability in Malaysia and the opening of India's first consulate there, strengthening bilateral ties and community outreach. Modi also pledged a new Thiruvalluvar Centre to honor shared heritage.

title: ‚ÄòThere was blood all around‚Äô: Knife rampage at Russian university injures four Indians
content: A stabbing attack in Ufa, Russia, injured several people, including four Indian students, the Indian Embassy confirmed. A 15-year-old assailant attacked students in a medical university hostel, also stabbing two police officers before harming himself. The injured have been hospitalized.

title: Over 1.7 crore tourists, including 36,000 foreigners, visited J&K in 2025: Govt
content: Jammu & Kashmir welcomed over 1.7 crore tourists in 2025, including more than 36,000 international visitors. While no specific targets are set for 2026, the government is actively working to boost tourist numbers through various initiatives. The Home Stay program has proven successful and is slated for expansion, despite facing challenges like awareness and infrastructure gaps.

title: Amit Shah reviews development projects, reaffirms Modi govt‚Äôs push for prosperous J&K
content: Union home minister Amit Shah reviewed Jammu and Kashmir's development projects. He also stressed hydropower potential and welfare scheme saturation. Aggressive tourism marketing and sports infrastructure development were highlighted. The region will receive 50-year interest-free loans for capital projects. The government aims for a developed Jammu and Kashmir by 2047.

title: Strategic Forces Command successfully test-fires 3,000 km-range Agni-3 missile
content: India successfully test-fired its nuclear-capable Agni-3 ballistic missile, boasting a 3,000-km range, from Chandipur, Odisha. The surface-to-surface missile, launched from a mobile launcher as part of a regular training exercise, validated all operational and technical parameters. This test reinforces India's robust nuclear deterrent capabilities.

title: BJP mocks NC‚Äôs ‚Äòspecial status‚Äô call for J&K, says no return of Article 370
content: BJP leader Sunil Sharma challenged the National Conference's demand for Jammu and Kashmir's "special status," stating the term is not in the Indian Constitution. Sunil Sharma argued that Article 370, which NC claims defined this status, has been "buried," dismissing the demand as baseless and accusing NC of misleading voters.

title: Top PIO restaurateur found guilty of spiking woman‚Äôs drink at Annabel‚Äôs in Mayfair
content: An Indian-origin restaurateur, owner of Michelin-starred Benares, has been convicted of drugging a woman's cocktail at Annabel's with intent to overpower her for sex. Staff intervened, preventing her from drinking the spiked 'Spicy Margarita' laced with GBL. Police found GBL traces in a vanilla extract bottle and at his home.

title: T20 WC: India survive USA test; register 29-run win with Suryakumar's heroics
content: India secured a 35-run victory against the USA in their T20 World Cup opener. Despite a shaky batting performance, Suryakumar Yadav's unbeaten 84 guided India to 161. Arshdeep Singh and Mohammed Siraj then dismantled the USA's top order, setting up a comfortable win for the hosts.

title: Shia Muslims protest in Kashmir over deadly blast at Islamabad mosque
content: Kashmiri Shia Muslims held protests across the region condemning a suicide bombing at a mosque in Islamabad. The attack killed over 30 people during Friday prayers. Demonstrations occurred in Srinagar, Baramulla, and Bandipora. Protesters voiced anger against the Pakistani government and expressed solidarity with the victims. Some raised slogans supporting Syed Hassan Nasrallah, Palestine, and Hezbollah.

title: Video: The Horrific Moment 'Tsunami' Ride Snapped Mid-Air At Surajkund Mela
content: A video from the Surajkund Fair in Faridabad shows the Tsunami swing moments before it broke mid-air and fell to the ground on Saturday evening.

title: Speeding Audi Runs Over Family Distributing Wedding Cards On Bike, 3 Killed
content: Three members of a family were killed after a speeding Audi car hit their motorcycle from behind in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district last evening.

title: 2 Dead, Several Injured As Under-Construction Building Collapses In Rajasthan's Kota
content: The deaths in the building collapse in Rajasthan's Kota rose to two, while at least 13 people were reported injured, officials said.

title: Nazi Slogans, 'Blood' Swastika: How Russia University Attack Unfolded
content: During a frenzied attack in a medical university's dormitory that housed foreign students in Russia, the 15-year-old attacker shouted nationalist slogans about the Holocaust, a local news media report claimed.

title: "We Will Pay, Return Our Mother":  US News Anchor Appeals To Kidnappers
content: Savannah Guthrie told the potential kidnappers of her mother Nancy Guthrie on Saturday that the family is prepared to pay for her safe return, as the frantic search for the 84-year-old Arizona resident has entered a seventh day.

title: 8-Point Safety Framework Issued After Delhi Biker's Death In Janakpuri
content: The Chief Minister flagged serious lapses in safety arrangements at excavation sites and warned that officers and contractors will be held accountable if negligence is found.

title: "Difficult Decisions Taken": Washington Post CEO Resigns After Mass Layoffs
content: Washington Post publisher and CEO Will Lewis is leaving the newspaper, it announced on Saturday after carrying out widespread layoffs this week.

title: India Gains In-Orbit Spying Capability, Can Now Snoop On Enemy Satellites
content: In a significant milestone for India's growing private space sector, Ahmedabad-based Azista Industries Private Limited through its aerospace vertical has demonstrated a new indigenous capability to image objects in orbit from another satellite

title: NDTV Profit Conclave 2026: LCA Tejas Won't Become Dated. Defence Secretary Explains Why
content: The Indian Air Force (IAF) has placed a large order for 180 Light Combat Aircraft (LCA) Tejas. However, some have speculated that by the time the IAF gets all the aircraft it had ordered, these platforms would become dated.

title: Over 70 School Children Fall Ill After Eating Mid-Day Meal In Bihar
content: More than 70 schoolchildren fell ill after consuming the mid-day meal at an Upgraded Middle School in Karu Tola at Sahugarh under Madhepura Sadar block of Bihar on Saturday, triggering panic among teachers, parents and locals.

title: 'Indian Consulate Will Open In Malaysia, Bring Our Nations Closer': PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday announced that an Indian Consulate will also be opened soon in Malaysia, bringing the two nations even closer.

title: Delhi Traffic Police Tests Laser Speed Guns To Boost Enforcement
content: Delhi Traffic Police has intensified speed enforcement measures along the NH-44 corridor by conducting trials of handheld laser speed guns at the Libaspur Bus Stand area, officials said on Saturday.

title: All About Muhammad Yunus, The Nobel Laureate Leading Bangladesh's Interim Government
content: He was awarded the Nobel Peace Prize in 2006 for his efforts to combat poverty and promote economic and social development from the grassroots.

title: UP Man Arrested While Leaving For Honeymoon After Evading Cops At Wedding
content: An accused, wanted in connection with an alleged assault and vandalism incident at a hotel here, was arrested from Maharashtra's Satara district while leaving on a honeymoon with his newly-wed wife, an official said on Saturday.

title: Many Feared Trapped After 3-Storey Building Collapses In Rajasthan's Kota
content: A three-storey building collapsed in Rajasthan's Kota on Saturday night, sparking fears that several people may be trapped under the debris, an official said.

title: Delhi's Mayur Vihar Pocket 1 Metro Station Renamed Shri Ram Mandir Mayur Vihar
content: The Mayur Vihar Pocket 1 Metro Station in East Delhi has been renamed Shri Ram Mandir Mayur Vihar, following a long-standing demand from locals and the community, an official said on Saturday.

title: Blanket, Disproportionate Freezing Of Bank Accounts Arbitrary: Delhi High Court
content: Blanket or disproportionate freezing of bank accounts, when the account holder is neither an accused nor a suspect in an investigation, is manifestly arbitrary and against one's fundamental right to livelihood, the Delhi High Court has said.

title: Gangster Joga Pholriwal Among 4 Charged For AAP Leader's Murder In Jalandhar
content: Punjab Police have registered a case against two named persons, including a foreign-based gangster, and two unknown individuals in connection with the daylight murder of AAP leader Lucky Oberoi in Jalandhar on Friday

title: 4 Indian Students Injured After Knife Attack In Russian College: Embassy
content: Four Indian students were among several people who were injured in an attack in Russia's Ufa, the Indian embassy in Moscow said in a post on X.

title: US Attacks Venezuela Highlights: Shots Fired, Drones Fly Over Venezuela Presidential Palace
content: US-Venezuela Conflict Highlights: Unidentified drones flew over the Miraflores palace in central Caracas and security forces opened fire in response around 8 pm (0000 GMT), the source said.
